draw::Drawing Class Reference

Documentation

This is the base class for creating drawings. A Drawing class allows for nesting and positioning of graphics within a bitmap.

Public Member Functions

virtual void draw (const DrawingAttr &attr)
 
virtual void draw_to_scale (const DrawingScaledAttr &attr)

static sg_dim_t draw::Drawing::dim_on_bitmap ( const DrawingAttr &  attr)
static

Return the dimensions (in pixels) if any Element is drawn on the specified bitmap

virtual void draw::Drawing::draw ( const DrawingAttr &  attr)
virtual

Draw the element on the specified bitmap.

This method draws the element on the specified bitmap. It uses the elements dimensions (see set_dim()) as a percentage of the bitmap size. So if an element's dimensions are set using set_dim(50,50), the element will occupy half the width and half the height of the destination bitmap.

Here is an example of drawing a labeled graphic:

#include <sgfx/draw.hpp>

Since label has a height of 20 and is drawn at 5, the bottom of label will be at about 25. gfx has a width of 50 and is drawn at 25 which means it will span from 25 to 75 with the center at 50.

Parameters
bA pointer to the destination bitmap
xX offset in element coordinates (percentage of screen width; see Element::scale)
yY offset in element coordinates (percentage of screen height; see Element::scale)
centerIf true object will be centered at x
Returns
The screen dimensions where the element was drawn

Reimplemented in ui::List.

virtual void draw::Drawing::draw_to_scale ( const DrawingScaledAttr &  attr)
virtual

This methods draws the drawing on the specified attributes.

Parameters
attrSpecifies the bitmap, point and area to draw the drawing

Reimplemented in draw::Icon, ui::List, draw::TextBox, draw::Text, ui::ListItem, draw::ProgressBar, draw::ProgressArc, draw::ProgressCircle, draw::Rect, and draw::Panel.

static drawing_size_t draw::Drawing::scale ( )
inlinestatic

This value determines how all objects are scaled. The default value is 1000. This means a value of 500 is half the target bitmap.
